intro: Hieracium schmidtii subsp. winkleri, commonly known as the Winkler's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing adaptations to arid environments. Its subspecies status highlights genetic differentiation from other Hieracium species, often due to geographic isolation. The morphology and ecology of H. schmidtii subsp. winkleri make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
